intro: Euporteria chilensis, commonly known as the Chilean wax tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Proteaceae. It is native to Chile and is characterized by its dense, waxy foliage that gives it its common name. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are narrow and leathery, and it produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. Euporteria chilensis is adapted to the arid and coastal environments of southern Chile, showing resilience to harsh climatic conditions.
